Art. 4.191. 
Formalities for holographic or international wills 
When an estate is opened for which a holographic will or a will in international form has been made, the following formalities must be applied: 
1¡ Any holographic will is, before being executed, presented to a civil law notary.
The civil law notary opens the will, if it is sealed, and draws up a record of the opening and of the state in which the will is found.   
The civil law notary files this will, as well as the report, in his minutes; 
2¡ in the case of a will in international form, the civil law notary to whom the will has been handed draws up the report on the opening and the state of the will.   
The civil law notary keeps the will in international form, together with the said record, in his minutes; 
3¡ the foregoing provisions are also applicable to Belgian consular agents with notarial competence under the conditions determined by the Ministers of Foreign Affairs and Justice.
